item.value: The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion). China has the most people, its population is 1.3 billion.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
Mount McKinley in Alaska is the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high. Alaska is also the largest state in America, it is 656,425 square miles in size.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The Chinese invented eyeglasses. Marco Polo reported seeing many pairs worn by the Chinese as early as 1275, 500 years before lens griding became an art in the West.
